intro: Kaukenia kummel, commonly known as the Kaukenia or a type of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, or yellow. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
